title: Web Designing Using HTML - Multiple Choice Questions
subtitle: NIOS Class 12 Computer Science - Lesson 24

questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
questions.explanation: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language. It is the basic language used to create web pages.

questions.question: HTML documents are saved with which file extension?
questions.explanation: HTML documents must be saved with the extension .html or .htm to be recognized and opened properly by web browsers.

questions.question: A tag in HTML is enclosed within:
questions.explanation: A tag in HTML is a special word enclosed within angular brackets (< and >) which conveys messages to the browser about structure or formatting.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a structural tag?
questions.explanation:

, and are formatting tags.

questions.question: A closing tag in HTML always starts with:
questions.explanation:
A closing tag in HTML always starts with a forward slash (/). For example, , ,

.

questions.question: What is a container element in HTML?
options: A tag without a closing tag
A tag that contains only text
An element from opening tag to corresponding closing tag
questions.explanation: A container element is the portion of HTML document from the opening tag up to the corresponding closing tag, like <HTML>...</HTML>.

questions.question: Which of the following is an empty element?
questions.explanation: is an empty element that doesn't need a corresponding closing tag. It stands alone and creates a line break.

questions.question: The general structure of an HTML document contains which two main elements?
questions.explanation: Every HTML document contains two main elements: Head element (optional, contains document information) and Body element (contains displayable content).

questions.question: The HEAD element contains:
options: Information to be displayed in browser window
Information about the document not displayed in browser
questions.explanation: The HEAD element contains information about the document (like title, meta tags) that is not displayed in the browser window.

questions.question: The BODY element contains:
options: Information to be displayed in browser window
questions.explanation: The BODY element contains all the information that is to be displayed in the browser window - text, images, links, etc.

questions.question: Which tag is used to start a new paragraph?
questions.explanation: tag is used to start a new paragraph. It leaves a blank line before starting the new paragraph.

questions.question: Which tag is used to make text bold?
questions.explanation: tag is used to make text bold. The text to be bolded is enclosed between and tags.

questions.question: Which tag is used to underline text?
questions.explanation: <U> tag is used to underline text. The text to be underlined is enclosed between <U> and </U> tags.

questions.question: Which tag is used to italicize text?
questions.explanation: tag is used to italicize text. The text to be italicized is enclosed between and tags.

questions.question: Which tag is used to center align text?
questions.explanation: <CENTER> tag is used to center align any part of the text. The text is enclosed between <CENTER> and </CENTER> tags.

questions.question: The <BLOCKQUOTE> tag is used to:
questions.explanation: <BLOCKQUOTE> tag is used to indent text (usually quotations) from both sides - left and right.

questions.question: Which tag is used to set specific font properties?
questions.explanation: <FONT> tag is used to set specific font properties like face, color, and size for any part of the text.

questions.question: Multiple tags can be applied to the same text. This concept is called:
questions.explanation: Applying multiple tags to the same part of text is called nesting of tags. For example: Bold and Underlined.

questions.question:
Which attribute of

tag is used to change paragraph alignment?
questions.explanation:
ALIGN attribute of

tag is used to change paragraph alignment. Values can be LEFT, RIGHT, CENTER, or JUSTIFY.

questions.question: Which attribute of <FONT> tag specifies the font name?
questions.explanation: FACE attribute of <FONT> tag specifies the font name/family to be used. Example: <FONT FACE="Arial">.

questions.question: The SIZE attribute of <FONT> tag accepts values from:
questions.explanation: SIZE attribute of <FONT> tag accepts integer values from 1 to 7, where 1 is smallest and 7 is largest font size.

questions.question: Color values in HTML can be specified as:
questions.explanation: Color values in HTML can be specified as valid color names (like RED, BLUE) or as #RRGGBB hexadecimal codes (like #FF0000 for red).

questions.question: If an attribute value contains multiple words, it must be:
questions.explanation: If an attribute value contains multiple words, it must be enclosed within double quotes. Single words may or may not use quotes.

questions.question: Which heading tag gives the largest heading?
questions.explanation: <H1> gives the largest heading size. Heading sizes gradually decrease from <H1> (largest) to <H6> (smallest).

questions.question: How many levels of headings are available in HTML?
questions.explanation: HTML provides 6 levels of headings from <H1> to <H6>. <H7> and <H8> are not valid tags and are ignored by browsers.

questions.question: Each heading tag automatically:
questions.explanation: Each heading tag automatically starts as a new paragraph, and the text following it also starts as a new paragraph.

questions.question: The <HR> tag is used to:
questions.explanation: <HR> tag is used to draw a horizontal line (Horizontal Rule) to separate sections of a web page.

questions.question: Which attribute of <HR> specifies the thickness of the line?
questions.explanation: SIZE attribute of <HR> tag specifies the height/thickness of the horizontal rule in pixels.

questions.question: WIDTH="50%" in <HR> tag means:
questions.explanation: WIDTH="50%" means the horizontal rule will be 50% of the browser window width. Without % sign, it would be pixels.

questions.question: NOSHADE attribute of <HR> tag:
options: Makes the rule solid instead of shaded
questions.explanation: NOSHADE attribute specifies that the horizontal rule should be solid and not shaded (which is the default appearance).

questions.question: The <TITLE> tag is placed in which element?
questions.explanation: The <TITLE> tag is placed in the HEAD element. It sets the text that appears in the browser's title bar.

questions.question: If an HTML document doesn't contain a title, what appears in the title bar?
questions.explanation: If an HTML document doesn't contain a title, the file name of the HTML document is displayed in the browser's title bar.

questions.question: Which attribute of <BODY> sets the background color?
questions.explanation: BGCOLOR attribute of <BODY> tag is used to specify the background color of the web page.

questions.question: Which attribute of <BODY> sets the text color?
questions.explanation: TEXT attribute of <BODY> tag sets the color of normal text in the document. The default text color is black.

questions.question: BACKGROUND attribute of <BODY> tag is used to:
questions.explanation: BACKGROUND attribute of <BODY> tag is used to specify an image to be shown in the background of the web page.

questions.question: What happens if a background image is smaller than the browser window?
questions.explanation: If the background image is smaller than the browser window, it will be tiled (repeated) to fit the entire window.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid color name in HTML?
questions.explanation: TRANSPARENT is not a valid color name. Valid color names include RED, BLUE, GREEN, YELLOW, CYAN, etc.

questions.question: The <PRE> tag is used to:
options: Display predefined text preserving spaces and line breaks
questions.explanation: <PRE> tag displays text in a fixed-width font and preserves both spaces and line breaks exactly as typed.

questions.question: In HTML, when the browser encounters an invalid tag, it:
questions.explanation: When browsers encounter invalid tags (like <H7> or <H8>), they ignore these tags completely and continue processing the rest of the document.

questions.question: Which is the correct way to apply both bold and underline to text?
questions.explanation: The correct way to nest tags is Text - opening tags in order, then closing tags in reverse order.

questions.question: Default paragraph alignment in HTML is:
questions.explanation:
By default, paragraphs in HTML are left-aligned. You can change this using the ALIGN attribute of

tag.

questions.question: Multiple attributes in a tag are separated by:
questions.explanation: Multiple attributes in a tag are separated by spaces. For example: <FONT FACE="Arial" SIZE=3 COLOR=red>.

questions.question: What type of software is a web browser?
options: Application software used to surf Internet
questions.explanation: A web browser is application software used to surf the Internet and display web pages. Examples include Chrome, Firefox, Edge.

questions.question: A website is:
options: A collection of interlinked web pages
questions.explanation: A website is a collection of interlinked web pages that are connected through hyperlinks and usually share a common domain.

questions.question: Web pages can contain which of the following components?
options: Text, images, hyperlinks, forms, audio, video
questions.explanation: Web pages can contain various components including text, images, hyperlinks, forms, audio, video, and interactive elements.

questions.question: HTML documents can be created in:
questions.explanation: HTML documents are text files and can be created in any text editor like Notepad, Notepad++, or specialized HTML editors.

questions.question: To view an HTML document as a web page, you need to:
options: Save it and open in a text editor
Upload it to the internet first
Open it in a web browser
questions.explanation: To view an HTML document as a web page, you need to open the .html file in a web browser, which will render and display it properly.
